page.title: 01RASHFIELD DISTRICT.
page.content: Our school is situated in the south-west side of Argyll, known as the Cowal Peninsula. It is close to the main road to Glasgow (A815). This rural area is mainly used for forestry and farming. There are 4 farms, the largest one being a dairy farm. The forestry land is divided between the Economic Forestry Group, the Forestry Commission and Tilhill Forestry Group. There are no villages in our area but quite a few scattered communities. Tourists are well catered for by two caravan parks and a camping site. The wooded scenery is beautiful and there are good forest walks. The River Eachaig flows through our area and is very popular with fishermen.
